Directed by Mikhail Romm, Elem Klimov, Marlene Hutsiev, Herman Lavrov

Description: Written by Solomon Zenin, Alexander Novogrudskiy, Mikhail Romm.

The latest film by Mikhail Romm was to be called "The World Today". M. Romm did not finish the job. Elem Klimov, Marlene Hutsiev and Herman Lavrov completed movie and called it "Still, I believe ..."

In the first part of the film is the voice of M. Romm. The author, as "old as the century", offers a "run" on the history of XX century, to remember. Comment M. Romm is interrupted after the description of the two world wars, on the events of the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.
The base tape - archival newsreel footage. The film consists of two unequal length, parts. The second part is devoted to the modern (at the time of the film) the world, here, in addition to the chronicle, often used excerpts from interviews with students and young people in Europe.
